title: You can always feel product/market fit when it's happening
author: Marc Andreessen

style_data.description: Claude Monet's broken brushwork technique capturing fleeting light effects
style_data.base_prompt: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value
style_data.color_philosophy: Colors that interact optically to create new emotional temperatures and atmospheric effects
style_data.brush_approach: Quick confident strokes that capture essence and light rather than precise form
style_data.light_focus: Fleeting effects of light and atmosphere as primary subject matter

prompt.text: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value. Capturing the vibe of movement, flow, in-the-zone. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.base: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value
components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it:
Timeless piece. Describes the mission of investing and building, and captures the feeling when it's working and when it's not, without listing a metric. I re-read it a couple times a year.

Known irony - personal projects don't have PMF :)

formatted_content.html:
And you can always feel product/market fit when it's happening.

The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account.

You're hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they've heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house.
formatted_content.plain:
**And you can always feel product/market fit when it's happening.**

The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account.

You're hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they've heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house.

Known irony - this nano banana sandbox is something I wanted to make for myself. :)
